When EMS arrived she was able to answer some of the EMS questions. She was brought to . Per EMS left arm and leg were flaccid on the scene. No further details were available regarding what this looked like. She received 2 mg Ativan and was intubated presumably for airway protection. She was given Keppra and dexamethasone, And transferred here. Lactate was 5.5. Other labs mostly unremarkable. UA wnl. Her son states she had not reported any headache or weakness or other neurological symptoms prior to today. He was not aware of her having any infectious symptoms. She was found to have a R lung mass in after imaging, done for symptoms of dyspnea and chest pressure. Bronchoscopy non diagnostic. CT guided biopsy showed SCC. PET scan on showed only local disease. The lung cancer was pending further management following her most recent clinic visit. Brief Hospital Course: F with known SCC of the lung (Dx presented after seizure at home found to have right sided mets with vasogenic edema, initially requiring intubation for airway protection. After loading with Keppra, she had no further seizure activity. She was put on dexamethasone for vasogenic edema surrounding her mets. She was evaluated by radiation oncology and underwent mapping for SBRT. She was seen by medical oncology. She had an unstable L shoulder dislocation requiring multiple reductions by orthopedic surgery and was placed in a sling.
